00007 std::string
00008 SgAsmPEFileHeader::rvasize_pair_name(PairPurpose idx, const char **short_name)
00009 {
00010     const char *full="", *abbr="";
00011     switch (idx) {
00012         case PAIR_EXPORTS:              full="Export Table";            abbr="Exports";   break;
00013         case PAIR_IMPORTS:              full="Import Table";            abbr="Imports";   break;
00014         case PAIR_RESOURCES:            full="Resource Table";          abbr="Rsrc";      break;
00015         case PAIR_EXCEPTIONS:           full="Exception Table";         abbr="Excpns";    break;
00016         case PAIR_CERTIFICATES:         full="Certificate Table";       abbr="Certs";     break;
00017         case PAIR_BASERELOCS:           full="Base Relocation Table";   abbr="BaseReloc"; break;
00018         case PAIR_DEBUG:                full="Debug";                   abbr="Debug";     break;
00019         case PAIR_ARCHITECTURE:         full="Architecture";            abbr="Arch";      break;
00020         case PAIR_GLOBALPTR:            full="Global Ptr";              abbr="GlobPtr";   break;
00021         case PAIR_TLS:                  full="TLS Table";               abbr="TLS";       break;
00022         case PAIR_LOADCONFIG:           full="Load Config Table";       abbr="LCT";       break;
00023         case PAIR_BOUNDIMPORT:          full="Bound Import Table";      abbr="BIT";       break;
00024         case PAIR_IAT:                  full="Import Address Table";    abbr="IAT";       break;
00025         case PAIR_DELAYIMPORT:          full="Delay Import Descriptor"; abbr="DID";       break;
00026         case PAIR_CLRRUNTIME:           full="CLR Runtime Header";      abbr="CLRHdr";    break;
00027         case PAIR_RESERVED15:           full="Reserved Pair 15";        abbr="Pair15";    break;
00028         // default:  NOT PRESENT (it would prevent compiler warnings for newly added enum members)
00029     }
00030 
00031     if (short_name)
00032         *short_name = abbr;
00033     return full;
00034 }

00036 /* Construct a new PE File Header with default values. */
00037 void
00038 SgAsmPEFileHeader::ctor()
00039 {
00040     ROSE_ASSERT(get_file()!=NULL);
00041     ROSE_ASSERT(get_size()>0);
00042 
00043     set_name(new SgAsmBasicString("PE File Header"));
00044     set_synthesized(true);
00045     set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00046 
00047     p_rvasize_pairs = new SgAsmPERVASizePairList(this);
00048 
00049     /* Magic number */
00050     p_magic.clear();
00051     p_magic.push_back('P');
00052     p_magic.push_back('E');
00053     p_magic.push_back('\0');
00054     p_magic.push_back('\0');
00055 
00056     /* Executable Format */
00057     ROSE_ASSERT(p_exec_format!=NULL);
00058     p_exec_format->set_family(FAMILY_PE);
00059     p_exec_format->set_purpose(PURPOSE_EXECUTABLE);
00060     p_exec_format->set_sex(ORDER_LSB);
00061     p_exec_format->set_word_size(4);
00062     p_exec_format->set_version(0);
00063     p_exec_format->set_is_current_version(true);
00064     p_exec_format->set_abi(ABI_NT);
00065     p_exec_format->set_abi_version(0);
00066 
00067     /* Default instruction architecture */
00068     p_e_cpu_type = 0x014c; /*i386*/
00069     p_isa = ISA_IA32_386;
00070 
00071     p_e_time = time(NULL);
00072     p_e_nt_hdr_size = sizeof(PE32OptHeader_disk);
00073 }
00074 
00078 bool
00079 SgAsmPEFileHeader::is_PE(SgAsmGenericFile *file)
00080 {
00081     /* Turn off byte reference tracking for the duration of this function. We don't want our testing the file contents to
00082      * affect the list of bytes that we've already referenced or which we might reference later. */
00083     bool was_tracking = file->get_tracking_references();
00084     file->set_tracking_references(false);
00085 
00086     try {
00087         /* Check DOS File Header magic number at beginning of the file */
00088         unsigned char dos_magic[2];
00089         file->read_content(0, dos_magic, sizeof dos_magic);
00090         if ('M'!=dos_magic[0] || 'Z'!=dos_magic[1])
00091             throw 1;
00092 
00093         /* Read four-byte offset of potential PE File Header at offset 0x3c */
00094         uint32_t lfanew_disk;
00095         file->read_content(0x3c, &lfanew_disk, sizeof lfanew_disk);
00096         rose_addr_t pe_offset = le_to_host(lfanew_disk);
00097         
00098         /* Look for the PE File Header magic number */
00099         unsigned char pe_magic[4];
00100         file->read_content(pe_offset, pe_magic, sizeof pe_magic);
00101         if ('P'!=pe_magic[0] || 'E'!=pe_magic[1] || '\0'!=pe_magic[2] || '\0'!=pe_magic[3])
00102             throw 1;
00103     } catch (...) {
00104         file->set_tracking_references(was_tracking);
00105         return false;
00106     }
00107     
00108     file->set_tracking_references(was_tracking);
00109     return true;
00110 }
00111 
00114 SgAsmPEFileHeader*
00115 SgAsmPEFileHeader::parse()
00116 {
00117     SgAsmGenericHeader::parse();
00118     
00119     /* Read header, zero padding if the file isn't large enough */
00120     PEFileHeader_disk fh;
00121     if (sizeof(fh)>get_size())
00122         extend(sizeof(fh)-get_size());
00123     if (sizeof(fh)!=read_content_local(0, &fh, sizeof fh, false))
00124         fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmPEFileHeader::parse: warning: short read of PE header at byte 0x%08"PRIx64"\n", get_offset());
00125 
00126     /* Check magic number before getting too far */
00127     if (fh.e_magic[0]!='P' || fh.e_magic[1]!='E' || fh.e_magic[2]!='\0' || fh.e_magic[3]!='\0')
00128         throw FormatError("Bad PE magic number");
00129 
00130     /* Decode COFF file header */
00131     p_e_cpu_type           = le_to_host(fh.e_cpu_type);
00132     p_e_nsections          = le_to_host(fh.e_nsections);
00133     p_e_time               = le_to_host(fh.e_time);
00134     p_e_coff_symtab        = le_to_host(fh.e_coff_symtab);
00135     p_e_coff_nsyms         = le_to_host(fh.e_coff_nsyms);
00136     p_e_nt_hdr_size        = le_to_host(fh.e_nt_hdr_size);
00137     p_e_flags              = le_to_host(fh.e_flags);
00138 
00139     /* Read the "Optional Header" (optional in the sense that not all files have one, but required for an executable), the
00140      * size of which is stored in the e_nt_hdr_size of the main PE file header. According to 
00141      * http://www.phreedom.org/solar/code/tinype the Windows loader honors the e_nt_hdr_size even when set to smaller than the
00142      * smallest possible documented size of the optional header. Also it's possible for the optional header to extend beyond
00143      * the end of the file, in which case that part should be read as zero. */
00144     PE32OptHeader_disk oh32;
00145     rose_addr_t need32 = sizeof(PEFileHeader_disk) + std::min(p_e_nt_hdr_size, (rose_addr_t)(sizeof oh32));
00146     if (need32>get_size())
00147         extend(need32-get_size());
00148     if (sizeof(oh32)!=read_content_local(sizeof fh, &oh32, sizeof oh32, false))
00149         fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmPEFileHeader::parse: warning: short read of PE Optional Header at byte 0x%08"PRIx64"\n", 
00150                 get_offset() + sizeof(fh));
00151     p_e_opt_magic = le_to_host(oh32.e_opt_magic);
00152     
00153     /* File format changes from ctor() */
00154     p_exec_format->set_purpose(p_e_flags & HF_PROGRAM ? PURPOSE_EXECUTABLE : PURPOSE_LIBRARY);
00155     p_exec_format->set_word_size(0x010b==p_e_opt_magic? 4 : 8);
00156 
00157     /* Decode the optional header. */
00158     rose_addr_t entry_rva;
00159     if (4==p_exec_format->get_word_size()) {
00160         p_e_lmajor             = le_to_host(oh32.e_lmajor);
00161         p_e_lminor             = le_to_host(oh32.e_lminor);
00162         p_e_code_size          = le_to_host(oh32.e_code_size);
00163         p_e_data_size          = le_to_host(oh32.e_data_size);
00164         p_e_bss_size           = le_to_host(oh32.e_bss_size);
00165         entry_rva              = le_to_host(oh32.e_entrypoint_rva);
00166         p_e_code_rva           = le_to_host(oh32.e_code_rva);
00167         p_e_data_rva           = le_to_host(oh32.e_data_rva);
00168         p_base_va              = le_to_host(oh32.e_image_base);
00169         p_e_section_align      = le_to_host(oh32.e_section_align);
00170         p_e_file_align         = le_to_host(oh32.e_file_align);
00171         p_e_os_major           = le_to_host(oh32.e_os_major);
00172         p_e_os_minor           = le_to_host(oh32.e_os_minor);
00173         p_e_user_major         = le_to_host(oh32.e_user_major);
00174         p_e_user_minor         = le_to_host(oh32.e_user_minor);
00175         p_e_subsys_major       = le_to_host(oh32.e_subsys_major);
00176         p_e_subsys_minor       = le_to_host(oh32.e_subsys_minor);
00177         p_e_reserved9          = le_to_host(oh32.e_reserved9);
00178         p_e_image_size         = le_to_host(oh32.e_image_size);
00179         p_e_header_size        = le_to_host(oh32.e_header_size);
00180         p_e_file_checksum      = le_to_host(oh32.e_file_checksum);
00181         p_e_subsystem          = le_to_host(oh32.e_subsystem);
00182         p_e_dll_flags          = le_to_host(oh32.e_dll_flags);
00183         p_e_stack_reserve_size = le_to_host(oh32.e_stack_reserve_size);
00184         p_e_stack_commit_size  = le_to_host(oh32.e_stack_commit_size);
00185         p_e_heap_reserve_size  = le_to_host(oh32.e_heap_reserve_size);
00186         p_e_heap_commit_size   = le_to_host(oh32.e_heap_commit_size);
00187         p_e_loader_flags       = le_to_host(oh32.e_loader_flags);
00188         p_e_num_rvasize_pairs  = le_to_host(oh32.e_num_rvasize_pairs);
00189     } else if (8==p_exec_format->get_word_size()) {
00190         /* We guessed wrong. This is a 64-bit header, not 32-bit. */
00191         PE64OptHeader_disk oh64;
00192         rose_addr_t need64 = sizeof(PEFileHeader_disk) + std::min(p_e_nt_hdr_size, (rose_addr_t)(sizeof oh64));
00193         if (need64>get_size())
00194             extend(need64-get_size());
00195         if (sizeof(oh64)!=read_content_local(sizeof fh, &oh64, sizeof oh64))
00196             fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmPEFileHeader::parse: warning: short read of PE Optional Header at byte 0x%08"PRIx64"\n", 
00197                     get_offset() + sizeof(fh));
00198         p_e_lmajor             = le_to_host(oh64.e_lmajor);
00199         p_e_lminor             = le_to_host(oh64.e_lminor);
00200         p_e_code_size          = le_to_host(oh64.e_code_size);
00201         p_e_data_size          = le_to_host(oh64.e_data_size);
00202         p_e_bss_size           = le_to_host(oh64.e_bss_size);
00203         entry_rva              = le_to_host(oh64.e_entrypoint_rva);
00204         p_e_code_rva           = le_to_host(oh64.e_code_rva);
00205      // p_e_data_rva           = le_to_host(oh.e_data_rva);             /* not in PE32+ */
00206         p_base_va              = le_to_host(oh64.e_image_base);
00207         p_e_section_align      = le_to_host(oh64.e_section_align);
00208         p_e_file_align         = le_to_host(oh64.e_file_align);
00209         p_e_os_major           = le_to_host(oh64.e_os_major);
00210         p_e_os_minor           = le_to_host(oh64.e_os_minor);
00211         p_e_user_major         = le_to_host(oh64.e_user_major);
00212         p_e_user_minor         = le_to_host(oh64.e_user_minor);
00213         p_e_subsys_major       = le_to_host(oh64.e_subsys_major);
00214         p_e_subsys_minor       = le_to_host(oh64.e_subsys_minor);
00215         p_e_reserved9          = le_to_host(oh64.e_reserved9);
00216         p_e_image_size         = le_to_host(oh64.e_image_size);
00217         p_e_header_size        = le_to_host(oh64.e_header_size);
00218         p_e_file_checksum      = le_to_host(oh64.e_file_checksum);
00219         p_e_subsystem          = le_to_host(oh64.e_subsystem);
00220         p_e_dll_flags          = le_to_host(oh64.e_dll_flags);
00221         p_e_stack_reserve_size = le_to_host(oh64.e_stack_reserve_size);
00222         p_e_stack_commit_size  = le_to_host(oh64.e_stack_commit_size);
00223         p_e_heap_reserve_size  = le_to_host(oh64.e_heap_reserve_size);
00224         p_e_heap_commit_size   = le_to_host(oh64.e_heap_commit_size);
00225         p_e_loader_flags       = le_to_host(oh64.e_loader_flags);
00226         p_e_num_rvasize_pairs  = le_to_host(oh64.e_num_rvasize_pairs);
00227     } else {
00228         throw FormatError("unrecognized Windows PE optional header magic number");
00229     }
00230 
00231     /* Magic number */
00232     p_magic.clear();
00233     for (size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(fh.e_magic); ++i)
00234         p_magic.push_back(fh.e_magic[i]);
00235 
00236     /* File format */
00237     ROSE_ASSERT(p_e_lmajor <= 0xffff && p_e_lminor <= 0xffff);
00238     p_exec_format->set_version((p_e_lmajor << 16) | p_e_lminor);
00239     p_exec_format->set_is_current_version(true); /*FIXME*/
00240 
00241     /* Target architecture */
00242     switch (p_e_cpu_type) {
00243       case 0x0000:
00244         set_isa(ISA_UNSPECIFIED);
00245         break;
00246       case 0x014c:
00247         set_isa(ISA_IA32_386);
00248         break;
00249       case 0x014d:
00250         set_isa(ISA_IA32_486);
00251         break;
00252       case 0x014e:
00253         set_isa(ISA_IA32_Pentium);
00254         break;
00255       case 0x0162:
00256         set_isa(ISA_MIPS_MarkI); /* R2000, R3000 */
00257         break;
00258       case 0x0163:
00259         set_isa(ISA_MIPS_MarkII); /* R6000 */
00260         break;
00261       case 0x0166:
00262         set_isa(ISA_MIPS_MarkIII); /* R4000 */
00263         break;
00264       case 0x01a2: /*Hitachi SH3*/
00265       case 0x01a3: /*Hitachi SH3 with FPU*/
00266       case 0x01a6: /*Hitachi SH4*/
00267       case 0x01a8: /*Hitachi SH5*/
00268         set_isa(ISA_Hitachi_SH);
00269         break;
00270       case 0x01c0:
00271         set_isa(ISA_ARM_Family);
00272         break;
00273       case 0x01d3:
00274         set_isa(ISA_Matsushita_AM33);
00275         break;
00276       case 0x01f0: /*w/o FPU*/
00277       case 0x01f1: /*with FPU*/
00278         set_isa(ISA_PowerPC);
00279         break;
00280       case 0x0200:
00281         set_isa(ISA_IA64_Family);
00282         break;
00283       case 0x0266:
00284         set_isa(ISA_MIPS_16);
00285         break;
00286       case 0x0366:
00287         set_isa(ISA_MIPS_FPU);
00288         break;
00289       case 0x0466:
00290         set_isa(ISA_MIPS_16FPU);
00291         break;
00292       case 0x0ebc:
00293         set_isa(ISA_EFI_ByteCode);
00294         break;
00295       case 0x8664:
00296         set_isa(ISA_X8664_Family);
00297         break;
00298       case 0x9041:
00299         set_isa(ISA_Mitsubishi_M32R);
00300         break;
00301       default:
00302         fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmPEFileHeader::parse: warning: unrecognized e_cputype = 0x%x (%u)\n", p_e_cpu_type, p_e_cpu_type);
00303         set_isa(ISA_OTHER);
00304         break;
00305     }
00306 
00307     /* The NT loader normally maps this file header at the header's base virtual address. */
00308     set_mapped_preferred_rva(0);
00309     set_mapped_actual_va(0); /* will be assigned by BinaryLoader */
00310     set_mapped_size(p_e_header_size);
00311     set_mapped_alignment(0);
00312     set_mapped_rperm(true);
00313     set_mapped_wperm(false);
00314     set_mapped_xperm(false);
00315 
00316     /* Entry point. We will eventually bind the entry point to a particular section (in SgAsmPEFileHeader::parse) so that if
00317      * sections are rearranged, extended, etc. the entry point will be updated automatically. */
00318     add_entry_rva(entry_rva);
00319 
00320     /* The PE File Header has a fixed-size component followed by some number of RVA/Size pairs. The add_rvasize_pairs() will
00321      * extend  the header and parse the RVA/Size pairs. */
00322     if (get_e_num_rvasize_pairs() > 1000) {
00323         fprintf(stderr, "warning: PE File Header contains an unreasonable number of Rva/Size pairs. Limiting to 1000.\n");
00324         set_e_num_rvasize_pairs(1000);
00325     }
00326     add_rvasize_pairs();
00327 
00328     /* Construct the section table and its sections (non-synthesized sections). The specification says that the section table
00329      * comes after the optional (NT) header, which in turn comes after the fixed part of the PE header. The size of the
00330      * optional header is indicated in the fixed header. */
00331     rose_addr_t secttab_offset = get_offset() + sizeof(PEFileHeader_disk) + get_e_nt_hdr_size();
00332     rose_addr_t secttab_size = get_e_nsections() * sizeof(SgAsmPESectionTableEntry::PESectionTableEntry_disk);
00333     SgAsmPESectionTable *secttab = new SgAsmPESectionTable(this);
00334     secttab->set_offset(secttab_offset);
00335     secttab->set_size(secttab_size);
00336     secttab->parse();
00337     set_section_table(secttab);
00338 
00339     /* Parse the COFF symbol table */
00340     if (get_e_coff_symtab() && get_e_coff_nsyms()) {
00341         SgAsmCoffSymbolTable *symtab = new SgAsmCoffSymbolTable(this);
00342         symtab->set_offset(get_e_coff_symtab());
00343         symtab->parse();
00344         set_coff_symtab(symtab);
00345     }
00346 
00347     /* Associate RVAs with particular sections so that if a section's mapping is changed the RVA gets adjusted automatically. */
00348     ROSE_ASSERT(get_entry_rvas().size()==1);
00349     get_entry_rvas()[0].bind(this);
00350     set_e_code_rva(get_e_code_rva().bind(this));
00351     set_e_data_rva(get_e_data_rva().bind(this));
00352 
00353     /* Turn header-specified tables (RVA/Size pairs) into generic sections */
00354     create_table_sections();
00355     return this;
00356 }
00357 
00358 /* Encode the PE header into disk format */
00359 void *
00360 SgAsmPEFileHeader::encode(PEFileHeader_disk *disk) const
00361 {
00362     for (size_t i=0; i<NELMTS(disk->e_magic); i++)
00363         disk->e_magic[i] = get_magic()[i];
00364     host_to_le(p_e_cpu_type,           &(disk->e_cpu_type));
00365     host_to_le(p_e_nsections,          &(disk->e_nsections));
00366     host_to_le(p_e_time,               &(disk->e_time));
00367     host_to_le(p_e_coff_symtab,        &(disk->e_coff_symtab));
00368     host_to_le(p_e_coff_nsyms,         &(disk->e_coff_nsyms));
00369     host_to_le(p_e_nt_hdr_size,        &(disk->e_nt_hdr_size));
00370     host_to_le(p_e_flags,              &(disk->e_flags));
00371 
00372     return disk;
00373 }
00374 void *
00375 SgAsmPEFileHeader::encode(PE32OptHeader_disk *disk) const
00376 {
00377     host_to_le(p_e_opt_magic,          &(disk->e_opt_magic));
00378     host_to_le(p_e_lmajor,             &(disk->e_lmajor));

00380     host_to_le(p_e_code_size,          &(disk->e_code_size));
00381     host_to_le(p_e_data_size,          &(disk->e_data_size));
00382     host_to_le(p_e_bss_size,           &(disk->e_bss_size));
00383     host_to_le(get_entry_rva(),        &(disk->e_entrypoint_rva));
00384     host_to_le(p_e_code_rva,           &(disk->e_code_rva));
00385     host_to_le(p_e_data_rva,           &(disk->e_data_rva));
00386     host_to_le(get_base_va(),          &(disk->e_image_base));
00387     host_to_le(p_e_section_align,      &(disk->e_section_align));
00388     host_to_le(p_e_file_align,         &(disk->e_file_align));
00389     host_to_le(p_e_os_major,           &(disk->e_os_major));
00390     host_to_le(p_e_os_minor,           &(disk->e_os_minor));
00391     host_to_le(p_e_user_major,         &(disk->e_user_major));
00392     host_to_le(p_e_user_minor,         &(disk->e_user_minor));
00393     host_to_le(p_e_subsys_major,       &(disk->e_subsys_major));
00394     host_to_le(p_e_subsys_minor,       &(disk->e_subsys_minor));
00395     host_to_le(p_e_reserved9,          &(disk->e_reserved9));
00396     host_to_le(p_e_image_size,         &(disk->e_image_size));
00397     host_to_le(p_e_header_size,        &(disk->e_header_size));
00398     host_to_le(p_e_file_checksum,      &(disk->e_file_checksum));
00399     host_to_le(p_e_subsystem,          &(disk->e_subsystem));
00400     host_to_le(p_e_dll_flags,          &(disk->e_dll_flags));
00401     host_to_le(p_e_stack_reserve_size, &(disk->e_stack_reserve_size));
00402     host_to_le(p_e_stack_commit_size,  &(disk->e_stack_commit_size));
00403     host_to_le(p_e_heap_reserve_size,  &(disk->e_heap_reserve_size));
00404     host_to_le(p_e_heap_commit_size,   &(disk->e_heap_commit_size));
00405     host_to_le(p_e_loader_flags,       &(disk->e_loader_flags));
00406     host_to_le(p_e_num_rvasize_pairs,  &(disk->e_num_rvasize_pairs));
00407 
00408     return disk;
00409 }
00410 void *
00411 SgAsmPEFileHeader::encode(PE64OptHeader_disk *disk) const
00412 {
00413     host_to_le(p_e_opt_magic,          &(disk->e_opt_magic));
00414     host_to_le(p_e_lmajor,             &(disk->e_lmajor));
00415     host_to_le(p_e_lminor,             &(disk->e_lminor));
00416     host_to_le(p_e_code_size,          &(disk->e_code_size));
00417     host_to_le(p_e_data_size,          &(disk->e_data_size));
00418     host_to_le(p_e_bss_size,           &(disk->e_bss_size));
00419     host_to_le(get_entry_rva(),        &(disk->e_entrypoint_rva));
00420     host_to_le(p_e_code_rva,           &(disk->e_code_rva));
00421  // host_to_le(p_e_data_rva,           &(disk->e_data_rva)); /* not present in PE32+ */
00422     host_to_le(get_base_va(),          &(disk->e_image_base));
00423     host_to_le(p_e_section_align,      &(disk->e_section_align));
00424     host_to_le(p_e_file_align,         &(disk->e_file_align));
00425     host_to_le(p_e_os_major,           &(disk->e_os_major));
00426     host_to_le(p_e_os_minor,           &(disk->e_os_minor));
00427     host_to_le(p_e_user_major,         &(disk->e_user_major));
00428     host_to_le(p_e_user_minor,         &(disk->e_user_minor));
00429     host_to_le(p_e_subsys_major,       &(disk->e_subsys_major));
00430     host_to_le(p_e_subsys_minor,       &(disk->e_subsys_minor));
00431     host_to_le(p_e_reserved9,          &(disk->e_reserved9));
00432     host_to_le(p_e_image_size,         &(disk->e_image_size));
00433     host_to_le(p_e_header_size,        &(disk->e_header_size));
00434     host_to_le(p_e_file_checksum,      &(disk->e_file_checksum));
00435     host_to_le(p_e_subsystem,          &(disk->e_subsystem));
00436     host_to_le(p_e_dll_flags,          &(disk->e_dll_flags));
00437     host_to_le(p_e_stack_reserve_size, &(disk->e_stack_reserve_size));
00438     host_to_le(p_e_stack_commit_size,  &(disk->e_stack_commit_size));
00439     host_to_le(p_e_heap_reserve_size,  &(disk->e_heap_reserve_size));
00440     host_to_le(p_e_heap_commit_size,   &(disk->e_heap_commit_size));
00441     host_to_le(p_e_loader_flags,       &(disk->e_loader_flags));
00442     host_to_le(p_e_num_rvasize_pairs,  &(disk->e_num_rvasize_pairs));
00443 
00444     return disk;
00445 }
00446 
00448 void
00449 SgAsmPEFileHeader::set_rvasize_pair(PairPurpose idx, SgAsmPESection *section)
00450 {
00451     ROSE_ASSERT(get_rvasize_pairs()!=NULL);
00452     ROSE_ASSERT(section->get_parent()!=NULL);
00453     ROSE_ASSERT(isSgAsmPEFileHeader(section->get_header())!=NULL);
00454 
00455     if (idx>=16)
00456         fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmPEFileHeader::set_rvasize_pair: warning: index %u exceeds specification limit\n", (unsigned)idx);
00457 
00458     /* Extend array of rva/size pairs if necessary */
00459     if ((size_t)idx>=get_rvasize_pairs()->get_pairs().size()) {
00460         get_rvasize_pairs()->get_pairs().resize(idx+1, NULL);
00461         for (size_t i=0; i<=(size_t)idx; i++) {
00462             if (NULL==get_rvasize_pairs()->get_pairs()[i]) {
00463                 SgAsmPERVASizePair *pair = new SgAsmPERVASizePair(get_rvasize_pairs(), 0, 0);
00464                 get_rvasize_pairs()->get_pairs()[i] = pair;
00465             }
00466         }
00467     }
00468 
00469     SgAsmPERVASizePair *pair = get_rvasize_pairs()->get_pairs()[idx];
00470     ROSE_ASSERT(pair!=NULL);
00471     pair->set_e_rva(rose_rva_t(section->get_mapped_preferred_rva(), section));
00472     pair->set_e_size(section->get_mapped_size());
00473     pair->set_section(section);
00474 
00475     /* If the section has no name then give it one based on the RVA/Size index. This is mostly for convenience and debugging
00476      * since the name is never stored in the file. */
00477     if (section->get_name()->get_string().empty()) {
00478         const char *short_name;
00479         section->get_name()->set_string(rvasize_pair_name(idx, &short_name));
00480         section->set_short_name(short_name);
00481     }
00482 }
00483 
00485 void
00486 SgAsmPEFileHeader::update_rvasize_pairs()
00487 {
00488     for (size_t i=0; i<get_rvasize_pairs()->get_pairs().size(); i++) {
00489         SgAsmPERVASizePair *pair = get_rvasize_pairs()->get_pairs()[i];
00490         SgAsmGenericSection *section = pair->get_section();
00491         if (section) {
00492             pair->set_e_rva(rose_rva_t(section->get_mapped_preferred_rva(), section));
00493             pair->set_e_size(section->get_mapped_size());
00494         }
00495     }
00496 }
00497 
00498 /* Adds the RVA/Size pairs to the end of the PE file header */
00499 void
00500 SgAsmPEFileHeader::add_rvasize_pairs()
00501 {
00502     rose_addr_t pairs_offset = get_size();
00503     rose_addr_t pairs_size   = p_e_num_rvasize_pairs * sizeof(SgAsmPERVASizePair::RVASizePair_disk);
00504     SgAsmPERVASizePair::RVASizePair_disk pairs_disk;
00505 
00506     ROSE_ASSERT(p_rvasize_pairs != NULL);
00507     ROSE_ASSERT(p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs().size()==0);
00508     p_rvasize_pairs->set_isModified(true);
00509 
00510     extend(pairs_size);
00511     for (size_t i = 0; i < p_e_num_rvasize_pairs; i++, pairs_offset += sizeof pairs_disk) {
00512         if (sizeof(pairs_disk)!=read_content_local(pairs_offset, &pairs_disk, sizeof pairs_disk, false))
00513             fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmPEFileHeader::add_rvasize_pairs: warning: RVA/Size pair %zu at file offset 0x%08"PRIx64
00514                     " extends beyond the end of file (assuming 0/0)\n", i, get_offset()+pairs_offset);
00515         p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs().push_back(new SgAsmPERVASizePair(p_rvasize_pairs, &pairs_disk));
00516     }
00517 }
00518 
00519 /* Looks at the RVA/Size pairs in the PE header and creates an SgAsmGenericSection object for each one.  This must be done
00520  * after we build the mapping from virtual addresses to file offsets. */
00521 void
00522 SgAsmPEFileHeader::create_table_sections()
00523 {
00524 
00525     /* First, only create the sections. */
00526     for (size_t i=0; i<p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs().size(); i++) {
00527         SgAsmPERVASizePair *pair = p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs()[i];
00528         if (0==pair->get_e_size())
00529             continue;
00530 
00531         /* Table names come from PE file specification and are hard coded by RVA/Size pair index */
00532         const char *tabname_short;
00533         std::string tabname = rvasize_pair_name((PairPurpose)i, &tabname_short);
00534 
00535         /* Find the starting offset in the file.
00536          * FIXME: We have a potential problem here in that ROSE sections are always contiguous in the file but a section created
00537          *        from an RVA/Size pair is not necessarily contiguous in the file.  Normally such sections are in fact
00538          *        contiguous and we'll just ignore this for now.  In any case, as long as these sections only ever read their
00539          *        data via the same MemoryMap that we use here, everything should be fine. [RPM 2009-08-17] */
00540         rose_addr_t pair_va = get_base_va() + pair->get_e_rva();
00541         MemoryMap *map = get_loader_map();
00542         ROSE_ASSERT(map!=NULL);
00543         if (!map->exists(Extent(pair_va, pair->get_e_size()))) {
00544             fprintf(stderr, "SgAsmPEFileHeader::create_table_sections: warning: pair-%zu, rva=0x%08"PRIx64", size=%"PRIu64
00545                     " bytes \"%s\": unable to find a mapping for the virtual address (skipping)\n",
00546                     i, pair->get_e_rva().get_rva(), pair->get_e_size(), tabname.c_str());
00547             continue;
00548         }
00549         std::pair<Extent, MemoryMap::Segment> me = map->at(pair_va);
00550         rose_addr_t file_offset = me.second.get_buffer_offset(me.first, pair_va);
00551 
00552         /* Create the new section */
00553         SgAsmGenericSection *tabsec = NULL;
00554         switch (i) {
00555             case 0: {
00556                 /* Sometimes export sections are represented by a ".edata" section, and sometimes they're represented by an
00557                  * RVA/Size pair, and sometimes both point to the same part of the file. We don't want the exports duplicated
00558                  * in the AST, so we only create this table as exports if we haven't already seen some other export section. */
00559                 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &sections = get_sections()->get_sections();
00560                 bool seen_exports = false;
00561                 for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator si=sections.begin(); !seen_exports && si!=sections.end(); ++si)
00562                     seen_exports = isSgAsmPEExportSection(*si);
00563                 if (seen_exports) {
00564                     tabsec = new SgAsmGenericSection(get_file(), this);
00565                 } else {
00566                     tabsec = new SgAsmPEExportSection(this);
00567                 }
00568                 break;
00569             }
00570             case 1: {
00571                 /* Sometimes import sections are represented by a ".idata" section, and sometimes they're represented by an
00572                  * RVA/Size pair, and sometimes both point to the same part of the file.  We don't want the imports duplicated
00573                  * in the AST, so we only create this table as imports if we haven't already seen some other import section. */
00574                 SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &sections = get_sections()->get_sections();
00575                 bool seen_imports = false;
00576                 for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::iterator si=sections.begin(); !seen_imports && si!=sections.end(); ++si)
00577                     seen_imports = isSgAsmPEImportSection(*si);
00578                 if (seen_imports) {
00579                     tabsec = new SgAsmGenericSection(get_file(), this);
00580                 } else {
00581                     tabsec = new SgAsmPEImportSection(this);
00582                 }
00583                 break;
00584             }
00585             default: {
00586                 tabsec = new SgAsmGenericSection(get_file(), this);
00587                 break;
00588             }
00589         }
00590         tabsec->set_name(new SgAsmBasicString(tabname));
00591         tabsec->set_short_name(tabname_short);
00592         tabsec->set_synthesized(true);
00593         tabsec->set_purpose(SP_HEADER);
00594 
00595         tabsec->set_offset(file_offset);
00596         tabsec->set_size(pair->get_e_size());
00597         tabsec->set_file_alignment(1);
00598 
00599         tabsec->set_mapped_alignment(1);
00600         tabsec->set_mapped_preferred_rva(pair->get_e_rva().get_rva());
00601         tabsec->set_mapped_actual_va(pair->get_e_rva().get_rva()+get_base_va()); /*FIXME: not sure this is correct. [RPM 2009-09-11]*/
00602         tabsec->set_mapped_size(pair->get_e_size());
00603         tabsec->set_mapped_rperm(true);
00604         tabsec->set_mapped_wperm(false);
00605         tabsec->set_mapped_xperm(false);
00606         pair->set_section(tabsec);
00607         pair->set_e_rva(pair->get_e_rva().set_section(tabsec));
00608     }
00609 
00610     /* Now parse the sections */
00611     for (size_t i=0; i<p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs().size(); i++) {
00612         SgAsmPERVASizePair *pair = p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs()[i];
00613         SgAsmGenericSection *tabsec = pair->get_section();
00614         if (tabsec)
00615             tabsec->parse();
00616     }
00617 }
00618 
00619 /* Change size of PE header based on word size */
00620 bool
00621 SgAsmPEFileHeader::reallocate()
00622 {
00623     bool reallocated = SgAsmGenericHeader::reallocate();
00624     
00625     /* Resize if necessary */
00626     rose_addr_t need = sizeof(PEFileHeader_disk);
00627     if (4==get_word_size()) {
00628         need += sizeof(PE32OptHeader_disk);
00629     } else if (8==get_word_size()) {
00630         need += sizeof(PE64OptHeader_disk);
00631     } else {
00632         throw FormatError("unsupported PE word size");
00633     }
00634     need += p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs().size() * sizeof(SgAsmPERVASizePair::RVASizePair_disk);
00635     if (need<get_size()) {
00636         if (is_mapped()) {
00637             ROSE_ASSERT(get_mapped_size()==get_size());
00638             set_mapped_size(need);
00639         }
00640         set_size(need);
00641         reallocated = true;
00642     } else if (need>get_size()) {
00643         get_file()->shift_extend(this, 0, need-get_size(), SgAsmGenericFile::ADDRSP_ALL, SgAsmGenericFile::ELASTIC_HOLE);
00644         reallocated = true;
00645     }
00646 
00647     /* Make sure the RVA/Size pairs at the end of the header are consistent with the sections to which they point. Reallocate()
00648      * has already been called recursively for the sections. */
00649     update_rvasize_pairs();
00650 
00651     /* Make sure header is consistent with sections. Reallocate() has already been called recursively for the sections.
00652      * Count the number of sections in the table and update the header's e_nsections member. */
00653     if (p_section_table) {
00654         ROSE_ASSERT(p_section_table->get_header()==this);
00655         SgAsmGenericSectionList *all = get_sections();
00656         p_e_nsections = 0;
00657         for (size_t i=0; i<all->get_sections().size(); i++) {
00658             SgAsmPESection *pesec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmPESection*>(all->get_sections()[i]);
00659             if (pesec && pesec->get_section_entry()!=NULL)
00660                 p_e_nsections++;
00661         }
00662 
00663         rose_addr_t header_size = ALIGN_UP(p_section_table->get_offset() + p_section_table->get_size(),
00664                                            p_e_file_align>0 ? p_e_file_align : 1);
00665 #if 1
00666         /* The PE Specification regarding e_header_size (known as "SizeOfHeader" on page 14 of "Microsoft Portable Executable
00667          * and Common Object File Format Specification: Revision 8.1 February 15, 2008" is not always followed. We recompute
00668          * it here as being the minimum RVA from all the sections defined in the PE Section Table, but not smaller
00669          * than the value according to the specification. This alternate value is kept if it's already in the parse tree,
00670          * otherwise we use the correct value. (RPM 2008-10-21) */
00671         rose_addr_t min_offset = 0;
00672         for (size_t i=0, nfound=0; i<all->get_sections().size(); i++) {
00673             SgAsmPESection *pesec = dynamic_cast<SgAsmPESection*>(all->get_sections()[i]);
00674             if (pesec && pesec->get_section_entry()!=NULL) {
00675                 if (0==nfound++) {
00676                     min_offset = pesec->get_offset();
00677                 } else {
00678                     min_offset = std::min(min_offset, pesec->get_offset() );
00679                 }
00680             }
00681         }
00682 
00683         rose_addr_t header_size2 = std::max(header_size, min_offset);
00684         if (p_e_header_size==header_size2)
00685             header_size = header_size2;
00686 
00687         /* If the original header size was zero then don't change that--leave it at zero. Some tiny executables have a zero
00688          * value here and as a result, since this is near the end of the NT Optional Header, they can truncate the file and
00689          * the loader will fill the optional header with zeros when reading. (RPM 2008-11-11) */
00690         if (p_e_header_size==0)
00691             header_size = 0;
00692 #endif
00693         p_e_header_size = header_size;
00694     }
00695 
00696     /* The size of the optional header. If there's a section table then we use its offset to calculate the optional header
00697      * size in order to be compatible with the PE loader. Otherwise use the actual optional header size. */
00698     if (p_section_table) {
00699         ROSE_ASSERT(p_section_table->get_offset() >= get_offset() + sizeof(PEFileHeader_disk));
00700         p_e_nt_hdr_size = p_section_table->get_offset() - (get_offset() + sizeof(PEFileHeader_disk));
00701     } else if (4==get_word_size()) {
00702         p_e_nt_hdr_size = sizeof(PE32OptHeader_disk);
00703     } else if (8==get_word_size()) {
00704         p_e_nt_hdr_size = sizeof(PE64OptHeader_disk);
00705     } else {
00706         throw FormatError("invalid PE word size");
00707     }
00708             
00709     /* Update COFF symbol table related data members in the file header */
00710     if (get_coff_symtab()) {
00711         ROSE_ASSERT(get_coff_symtab()->get_header()==this);
00712         set_e_coff_symtab(get_coff_symtab()->get_offset());
00713         set_e_coff_nsyms(get_coff_symtab()->get_nslots());
00714     }
00715 
00716     /* Update some additional header fields */
00717     set_e_num_rvasize_pairs(get_rvasize_pairs()->get_pairs().size());
00718     set_e_opt_magic(4==get_word_size() ? 0x010b : 0x020b);
00719     set_e_lmajor((get_exec_format()->get_version() >> 16) & 0xffff);
00720     set_e_lminor(get_exec_format()->get_version() & 0xffff);
00721 
00722     /* Adjust the COFF Header's e_nt_hdr_size to accommodate the NT Optional Header in such a way that EXEs from tinype.com
00723      * don't change (i.e., don't increase e_nt_hdr_size if the bytes beyond it are zero anyway, and if they aren't then adjust
00724      * it as little as possible.  The RVA/Size pairs are considered to be part of the NT Optional Header. */
00725     size_t oh_size = p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs().size() * sizeof(SgAsmPERVASizePair::RVASizePair_disk);
00726     size_t rvasize_offset; /*offset with respect to "oh" buffer allocated below*/
00727     if (4==get_word_size()) {
00728         oh_size += sizeof(PE32OptHeader_disk);
00729     } else if (8==get_word_size()) {
00730         oh_size += sizeof(PE64OptHeader_disk);
00731     } else {
00732         throw FormatError("unsupported PE word size");
00733     }
00734     unsigned char *oh = new unsigned char[oh_size];
00735     if (4==get_word_size()) {
00736         encode((PE32OptHeader_disk*)oh);
00737         rvasize_offset = sizeof(PE32OptHeader_disk);
00738     } else if (8==get_word_size()) {
00739         encode((PE64OptHeader_disk*)oh);
00740         rvasize_offset = sizeof(PE64OptHeader_disk);
00741     } else {
00742         delete[] oh;
00743         throw FormatError("unsupported PE word size");
00744     }
00745     while (oh_size>p_e_nt_hdr_size) {
00746         if (0!=oh[oh_size-1]) break;
00747         --oh_size;
00748     }
00749     set_e_nt_hdr_size(oh_size);
00750     return reallocated;
00751 }
00752 
00753 /* Write the PE file header back to disk and all that it references */
00754 void
00755 SgAsmPEFileHeader::unparse(std::ostream &f) const
00756 {
00757     /* Write unreferenced areas back to the file before anything else. */
00758     unparse_holes(f);
00759     
00760     /* Write sections in the order of specialization, from least specialized to most specialized. This gives more specialized
00761      * sections a chance to overwrite the less specialized sections. */
00762     const SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList &sections = get_sections()->get_sections();
00763     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::const_iterator si=sections.begin(); si!=sections.end(); ++si) {
00764         if (V_SgAsmGenericSection==(*si)->variantT())
00765             (*si)->unparse(f);
00766     }
00767     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::const_iterator si=sections.begin(); si!=sections.end(); ++si) {
00768         if (V_SgAsmPESection==(*si)->variantT())
00769             (*si)->unparse(f);
00770     }
00771     for (SgAsmGenericSectionPtrList::const_iterator si=sections.begin(); si!=sections.end(); ++si) {
00772         if (V_SgAsmGenericSection!=(*si)->variantT() && V_SgAsmPESection!=(*si)->variantT())
00773             (*si)->unparse(f);
00774     }
00775 
00776     /* Encode the "NT Optional Header" before the COFF Header since the latter depends on the former. Adjust the COFF Header's
00777      * e_nt_hdr_size to accommodate the NT Optional Header in such a way that EXEs from tinype.com don't change (i.e., don't
00778      * increase e_nt_hdr_size if the bytes beyond it are zero anyway, and if they aren't then adjust it as little as possible.
00779      * The RVA/Size pairs are considered to be part of the NT Optional Header. */
00780     size_t oh_size = p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs().size() * sizeof(SgAsmPERVASizePair::RVASizePair_disk);
00781     size_t rvasize_offset; /*offset with respect to "oh" buffer allocated below*/
00782     if (4==get_word_size()) {
00783         oh_size += sizeof(PE32OptHeader_disk);
00784     } else if (8==get_word_size()) {
00785         oh_size += sizeof(PE64OptHeader_disk);
00786     } else {
00787         throw FormatError("unsupported PE word size");
00788     }
00789     unsigned char *oh = new unsigned char[oh_size];
00790     if (4==get_word_size()) {
00791         encode((PE32OptHeader_disk*)oh);
00792         rvasize_offset = sizeof(PE32OptHeader_disk);
00793     } else if (8==get_word_size()) {
00794         encode((PE64OptHeader_disk*)oh);
00795         rvasize_offset = sizeof(PE64OptHeader_disk);
00796     } else {
00797         throw FormatError("unsupported PE word size");
00798     }
00799     for (size_t i=0; i<p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs().size(); i++, rvasize_offset+=sizeof(SgAsmPERVASizePair::RVASizePair_disk)) {
00800         SgAsmPERVASizePair::RVASizePair_disk *rvasize_disk = (SgAsmPERVASizePair::RVASizePair_disk*)(oh+rvasize_offset);
00801         p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs()[i]->encode(rvasize_disk);
00802     }
00803     while (oh_size>p_e_nt_hdr_size) {
00804         if (0!=oh[oh_size-1]) break;
00805         --oh_size;
00806     }
00807     ROSE_ASSERT(p_e_nt_hdr_size==oh_size); /*set in reallocate()*/
00808 
00809     /* Write the fixed-length COFF Header */
00810     PEFileHeader_disk fh;
00811     encode(&fh);
00812     rose_addr_t spos = write(f, 0, sizeof fh, &fh);
00813 
00814     /* Write the following "NT Optional Header" */
00815     spos = write(f, spos, oh_size, oh);
00816 }
00817     
00818 /* Print some debugging information */
00819 void
00820 SgAsmPEFileHeader::dump(FILE *f, const char *prefix, ssize_t idx) const
00821 {
00822     char p[4096];
00823     if (idx>=0) {
00824         sprintf(p, "%sPEFileHeader[%zd].", prefix, idx);
00825     } else {
00826         sprintf(p, "%sPEFileHeader.", prefix);
00827     }
00828 
00829     int w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p));
00830     time_t t = p_e_time;
00831     char time_str[128];
00832     struct tm *tm = localtime(&t);
00833     if (tm) {
00834         strftime(time_str, sizeof time_str, "%c", tm);
00835     } else {
00836         strcpy(time_str, "INVALID");
00837     }
00838 
00839     SgAsmGenericHeader::dump(f, p, -1);
00840     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%04x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_cpu_type",          p_e_cpu_type, p_e_cpu_type);
00841     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                        p, w, "e_nsections",         p_e_nsections);
00842     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u (%s)\n",                   p, w, "e_time",              p_e_time, time_str);
00843     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n", p, w, "e_coff_symtab",       p_e_coff_symtab, p_e_coff_symtab);
00844     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                        p, w, "e_coff_nsyms",        p_e_coff_nsyms);
00845     if (p_coff_symtab) {
00846         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = [%d] \"%s\"\n",           p, w, "coff_symtab",
00847                 p_coff_symtab->get_id(), p_coff_symtab->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00848     } else {

00850     }
00851     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n", p, w, "e_nt_hdr_size",       p_e_nt_hdr_size, p_e_nt_hdr_size);
00852     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%04x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_flags",             p_e_flags, p_e_flags);
00853     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%04x %s\n",                 p, w, "e_opt_magic",         p_e_opt_magic,
00854             0x10b == p_e_opt_magic ? "PE32" : (0x20b == p_e_opt_magic ? "PE32+" : "other"));
00855     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u.%u\n",                     p, w, "linker_vers",         p_e_lmajor, p_e_lminor);

00865     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u.%u\n",                     p, w, "subsys_vers",         p_e_subsys_major, p_e_subsys_minor);
00866     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                        p, w, "e_reserved9",         p_e_reserved9);
00867     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_image_size",        p_e_image_size, p_e_image_size);
00868     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_header_size",       p_e_header_size, p_e_header_size);
00869     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_file_checksum",     p_e_file_checksum, p_e_file_checksum);
00870     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                        p, w, "e_subsystem",         p_e_subsystem);
00871     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%04x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_dll_flags",         p_e_dll_flags, p_e_dll_flags);
00872     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_stack_reserve_size",
00873             p_e_stack_reserve_size, p_e_stack_reserve_size);
00874     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_stack_commit_size", p_e_stack_commit_size, p_e_stack_commit_size);
00875     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_heap_reserve_size", p_e_heap_reserve_size, p_e_heap_reserve_size);
00876     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_heap_commit_size",  p_e_heap_commit_size, p_e_heap_commit_size);
00877     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = 0x%08x (%u)\n",               p, w, "e_loader_flags",      p_e_loader_flags, p_e_loader_flags);
00878     fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = %u\n",                        p, w, "e_num_rvasize_pairs", p_e_num_rvasize_pairs);
00879     for (unsigned i = 0; i < p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs().size(); i++) {
00880         char p2[256];
00881         int nprint __attribute__((unused)) = snprintf(p2, sizeof p2, "%s.pair[%d].", p, i);
00882         assert((size_t)nprint<sizeof p2);
00883         w = std::max(1, DUMP_FIELD_WIDTH-(int)strlen(p2));
00884         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = rva %s,\tsize 0x%08"PRIx64" (%"PRIu64")\n", p2, w, "..",
00885                 p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs()[i]->get_e_rva().to_string().c_str(),
00886                 p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs()[i]->get_e_size(), p_rvasize_pairs->get_pairs()[i]->get_e_size());
00887     }
00888     if (p_section_table) {
00889         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = [%d] \"%s\"\n", p, w, "section_table",
00890                 p_section_table->get_id(), p_section_table->get_name()->get_string(true).c_str());
00891     } else {
00892         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = none\n", p, w, "section_table");
00893     }
00894 
00895     if (variantT() == V_SgAsmPEFileHeader) //unless a base class
00896         hexdump(f, 0, std::string(p)+"data at ", p_data);
00897 
00898     /* Show the simulated loader memory map */
00899     const MemoryMap *map = get_loader_map();
00900     if (map) {
00901         map->dump(f, (std::string(p)+"loader_map: ").c_str());
00902     } else {
00903         fprintf(f, "%s%-*s = not defined\n", p, w, "loader_map");
00904     }
00905 }
